text:
Tested with JMeter 2.3RC4

I use several Include Controllers in separate Thread Groups.
When I place a  Http Authorization Manager on top of the test plan
all works fine. But when I place the Http Authorization Managers separately
in every Thread Group nothing works. The Http Samplers report me "not authorized"
exceptions.

text: Can you attach a sample test plan that does not work?

creator: frankyhro@gmx.de
text:
Created attachment 20841
Testpan with two jmx files in a zip file.

Two jmx files:
Test1.jmx : Testplan with a include controller, that is assigned to
"IncludeController.jmx"

IncludeController.jmx: Only displays the google main screen, but the Servername
and Port are in the "Http Defaults" in Test1.jmx

This testplan does not! work if you put the "Http defaults" as a child under
the thread group. But if you put the "Http defaults" into the root of the
testplan it works fine.

The include file is incorrect; it should not have a thread group in it.

From the documentation for the Include Controller:

"To use it, add samples to a simple controller, then save the simple 
controller as a jmx file. The file can then be used in a test plan."
